snippet: Mitt Romney tried to appeal to African-Americans while delivering a tough critique of President Obama’s policies at the N.A.A.C.P.’s annual convention.
abstract: Mitt Romney, speaking before the NAACP, delivers a tough critique of Pres Obama and attempts to make the case that he represents the better choice for blacks; Romney's assertions are met with a mix of cackles, boos and tepid applause.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker reported from Houston, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney tried to appeal to African-Americans while delivering a tough critique of President Obama’s policies at the N.A.A.C.P.’s annual convention.

headline.main: Romney Says He Offers Better Chance for Blacks
headline.print_headline: Romney Says He Offers Better Chance for Blacks

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations
